intro: Hieracium kildinense, commonly known as Kildin hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Kildin Island in the Russian Arctic. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist, tundra-like environments, showcasing a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium kildinense plays a minor role in the local ecosystem, contributing to the floral diversity of its Arctic habitat.
